metadata.title: CVE-2022-32742 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in Samba. Some SMB1 write requests were not correctlyrange-checked to ensure the client had sent enough data to fulfill thewrite, allowing server memory contents to be written into the file (orprinter) instead of client-supplied data. The client cannot control thearea of the server memory written to the file (or printer).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32742` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
libsmbclient - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
python3-samba - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
registry-tools - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
samba - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
samba-common - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
samba-libs - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
smbclient - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
winbind - 2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.13.17~dfsg-0ubuntu1.20.04.1').
